required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High Flow Nasal Cannula on Oxygenation During Urodynamic Study in Pediatric Population
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of High Flow Nasal Cannula on Oxygenation During Urodynamic Study in Pediatric Population

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effect of high flow nasal cannula for prevention of hypoxia during deep sedation in pediatric population

primary_outcome.time_frame: During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of peripheral pulse oximeter value lower than 95%

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of peripheral pulse oximeter value lower than 90%
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of changes in oxygen flow (control group) or FiO2 (HF group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)
During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)
During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)
During deep sedation (during approximately 1 hour after propofol infusion)

arm_group.description: Children in the control group receive oxygen via conventional nasal cannula during deep sedation. Oxygen flow is determined to set the fraction of inspired oxygen of 50%.
Children in the HF group receive oxygen via high flow nasal cannula during deep sedation. Fraction of inspired oxygen is set to 50%.

intervention.description: Oxygen is supplied via high flow nasal cannula. Heated air (2L/kg/min) is administered using Optiflow device (Fisher and Paykel Healthcare, Auckland, New Zealand).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged <7 years
- ASA class I, II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Respiratory disease
- Pneumothorax
- Increased ICP
- Nasal bleeding
- Previous airway surgery
- Trauma
- Pulmonary hypertension
